Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Events 1-3 Temperature around 20 21 C pressure low at 1 bar vibration zero no material flow tool position at 0 energy around 0 4 0 5 kWh This seems like idle or setup Maybe Machine Idle SETUP Events 4-6 Temperature rises sharply to 50 58 C pressure increases to 1 5 bar vibration jumps to 30 38 Hz material flow at 5 units s tool position moves from 5 to 10 mm energy increases to 2 3 kWh High temp vibration and flow suggest active processing Could be Cutting Metal since cutting often generates heat and vibration Events 7-8 Temperature drops to 40 C pressure rises to 2 bar vibration low at 10 Hz flow reduces to 2 units s tool position stable at 15 mm energy at 2 kWh Lower temp but pressure up material flow still happening Maybe Assembling Parts where pressure is used for joining but less heat and vibration Events 9 Temperature spikes to 80 C pressure stays at 2 bar vibration high at 50 Hz flow stops tool position same at 15 mm energy jumps to 5 kWh High temp and vibration with no flow sounds like Welding where intense heat and vibration occur but no material feed Events 10-12 Temperature drops to 30 then 25 C pressure back to 1 bar vibration minimal 1 5 Hz flow starts again at 1 unit s tool position moves to 20 mm energy around 1 5 1 6 kWh Moderate conditions with some flow and movement could be Quality Inspection where checks are done while material moves slowly Events 13-15 Back to initial idle state temp 20 21 C pressure 1 bar no vibration no flow tool at 0 energy low This is likely Machine Idle SETUP again possibly after finishing a cycle

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Wait but the user mentioned packaging as an activity too In this log after welding event 9 theres inspection 10-12 then idle Maybe packaging isnt captured here or its part of the inspection Hmm but the flow resumes in inspection so maybe that includes packaging steps Alternatively maybe inspection is separate and packaging isnt in this log The users list includes packaging but the data might not show it Lets stick to whats evident

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Rationale for each label Idle baseline readings no activity Cutting sharp increases in temp vibration flow tool movement Assembling moderate temp higher pressure steady flow tool position stable Welding extreme temp and vibration no flow Inspection moderate temp slight vibration flow resumes tool moves

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Also note the transitions from cutting to assembling temp drops pressure up then welding temp spikes flow stops then inspection temp moderate flow resumes The cycle ends back at idle

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So grouping Events 1-3 13-15 Idle Setup Events 4-6 Cutting Events 7-8 Assembling Event 9 Welding Events 10-12 Quality Inspection Yes that seems consistent with typical manufacturing steps The tool position increases during cutting and inspection stable during assembling and welding Energy correlates with activity intensity
